vision.notes: Dragonflies are highly visual predators. Many members of this family are brightly colored or have banded wings, suggesting a role for visual communication and mate recognition. Their compound eyes provide wide-field motion detection critical for intercepting prey.

mechanoreception.notes: Dragonfly nymphs possess stout bodies. Likely they can detect water movement using mechanoreceptors to detect prey and avoid predators. Adults can detect air currents.
